question: In many developing countries, which of the following are three major causes of death and disease?
option1: Lack of safe drinking water, increasing use of pesticides and thinning of the ozone layer
option2: contaminated food, global warming and industrial chloro-fluoro-carbons
option3: polluted air, greenhouse effect and soil erosion
option4: dirty water, contaminated food and polluted air
answer: dirty water, contaminated food and polluted air
explanation:
In many developing countries, three major causes of death and disease are dirty water, contaminated food and polluted air.
Toxins in industrial waste are the major cause of immune suppression, reproductive failure and acute poisoning. Infectious diseases, like cholera, typhoid fever [6] and other diseases gastroenteritis, diarrhea, vomiting, skin and kidney problem are spreading through polluted water.
Sulfur dioxide emitted from the combustion of fossil fuels like coal, petroleum and other factory combustibles are one the major cause of air pollution. Pollution emitting from vehicles including trucks, jeeps, cars, trains, airplanes cause an immense amount of pollution.
